hydratedSession.description:
• Changing your organisation to understand and adopt modern software engineering practices
  • What successful execution of Agile and DevOps cultures looks like
  • Enabling designers, engineers and product managers to collaborate in product delivery
  • Designing a self managed organisation: Enabling leaders to support the culture-shift and the team to do their job
  • Continuous delivery, machine learning and experimentation at Skyscanner
hydratedSession.name: Empowering Autonomous Teams from the Top Down

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
Bryan is the CTO at Skyscanner, responsible for enabling a 400-strong global team of software engineers, data scientists, product managers, and designers to earn the trust of hundreds of millions of travelers around the world by delivering a simple, elegant product experience.

Bryan has previously held leadership roles at Amazon Web Services, Skype, and Microsoft.

hydratedSession.description:
Alexa, the voice service that powers Amazon Echo, Echo Dot, Amazon Tap and Amazon Fire TV provides a set of built-in abilities that enable customers to interact with devices in a more intuitive way using voice. Examples of these skills include the ability to play music, answer general questions, set an alarm or timer and more.

  • Diving into Amazon’s machine learning model *Making AI and machine learning more accessible to all developers, product managers and designers
  • Proven best practices for designing voice user interfaces (VUI)
  • How to maximise usability of your voice experience
  • How to create compelling voice experiences
  • Building voice activated products - where products will turn to in the future
hydratedSession.name: Designing Voice Driven Experiences

hydratedSpeakers.bio: Noelle LaCharite is an evangelist. She is passionate about voice technology, AI bots and Mindful Leadership. As a Sr. Technical Program Manager at Amazon Alexa, she owns and manages projects that will help define the vision for Alexa’s voice experience, drive investments in accuracy and end-to-end voice experience quality and find opportunities for increasing innovation across the data science and engineering teams related to machine learning. She has spent many years as a technical trainer and evangelist for IBM, a Solution Architect for RedHat and in Education Leadership at Amazon Web Services. She has been an enterprise developer, architect and principle consultant over a decade. She has been voted a top 10 presenter at RedHat Summit and has spoken at dozens of technical and digital marketing events. As an Evangelist for voice technologies, she develops demonstrations, white papers and tutorials and speaks at technical conferences, seminars and executive meetings.

hydratedSession.description:
• Improving performance and removing baggage
  • Building with 2G networks in mind
  • App like UX built on the web
  • Challenges of being ahead of the curve
  • Embedding in your current architecture - Angular, Ember, React or plain JS.
  • What networks do and do not do
  • What about Native Apps
hydratedSession.name: Getting the Progressive Web Apps Edge

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
Amar Nagaram is the Vice President of Engineering at Flipkart. In his current role, he is heading the Customer Shopping Experience Engineering, Catalog Engineering and FinTech wing, developing products that redefine the shopping experience online and making online shopping affordable . He is passionate about building Mobile and Progressive Web products from the ground-up to deliver superior value and user experience to the end consumer. He is equally passionate about building great teams. He believes in a design language that prefers "People over Pixels". He is excited about start-ups that are solving challenging problems for emerging markets and he works with many such start-ups, mentoring them on all things Mobile. He is also an advisor to half a dozen startups. 

Prior to Flipkart, he worked at @WalmartLabs - he was involved in strategy development for Walmart’s next generation e-commerce Platform. He was also instrumental in setting up @walmartlabs India center of excellence.

hydratedSession.description:
• Analysing conflicts between Agile and UX: Speed of delivery vs Agile
  • Adapting Agile and Sprints to suit your own team
  • Understanding barriers and opportunities of working within a large organisation
  • The psychology of dealing with different business divisions and UX maturity levels
  • HIPPO: Proving the value in team collaboration through proof points
  • Moving beyond just centralised/decentralised teams
hydratedSession.name: Using Psychology Processes for Better Team Collaboration

hydratedSpeakers.job_title: Director of Digital Design, Data & Services

hydratedSession.description:
• How to decide what microservices to build, and what messages they should send
  • What are the patterns that you use to build message flows between services?
  • What are the ways that those messages flows will fail? Solving scalability
  • How do you distribute complexity evenly?
  • Discovery & other challenges
hydratedSession.name: Designing Microservice Architectures

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
Richard Rodger is a co-founder of nearForm.com. Richard is an expert and thought-leader in next-generation enterprise software delivery, with a focus on Node.js and microservices. He is currently writing The Tao of Microservices (available on early release from manning.com/books/the-tao-of-microservices), a comprehensive guide to designing and building microservice systems. His first book Mobile Application Development in the Cloud (Wiley, 2010) is one of the first major works on the intersection of Node.js, Cloud, and Mobile.


Richard was previously CTO of FeedHenry, a mobile application platform provider that was acquired by RedHat for €63.5m in 2014. Since Richard co-founded nearForm in 2011, the company has become the world’s largest Node.js and microservices consulting company. Richard has long been an active member and influencer of the open source software (OSS) community, specializing in OSS for enterprise. At nearForm, he has placed OSS at the hear of how the company works. He is the maintainer of senecajs.org, a microservices framework for Node.js that is a key component of nearForm’s software development and delivery capability. Richard is the host of the Dublin Microservices Meetup.

hydratedSession.description:
• Institutionalising experience design & accelerating the UX maturity model
  • Hiring strategy - a phased approach to hiring (and no bean bags)
  • Scaling up versus staying Agile: Running ‘squads’ like lean start-ups
  • Outcomes – deliver on the promise of UX inch by inch in this new Verizon world
  • Roadmaps, Lean and Kanban boards – cycle time, KPIs, Heart, ROI & metrics for UX
  • The golden ratio – how many experience designers does it take to change a company?
hydratedSession.name: The Highs and Lows of Building a 30-person Lean UX Team in 1 Year

hydratedSpeakers.bio: Donal O Mahony is Head of UX and Product Design in Fleetmatics, a Verizon Company. where he leads a team of researchers, content specialists, user experience designers and UI designers. He is responsible for all aspects of user research, product design and user experience and has grown the UX team from a standing start to 30 people within 1 year. Prior to joining Fleetmatics he was Director of UX and Design at HMH’s Dublin R&D office, where he led a team of 30 UX and UI designers. He is also a public speaker in the areas of UX and Design and has lectured in Trinity College Dublin and IADT. In a previous life, he was a musician and producer.

hydratedSession.description:
• What strategies are available for migrating to cloud? New projects or migrating existing systems?
  • The offerings are huge - what do teams really need to get started?
  • Security considerations of a cloud system
  • Simple governance structures for companies to enable developers but manage security / costs
hydratedSession.name: Getting Started with Cloud Infrastructure

hydratedSpeakers.bio: Tony has worked in technology for +20 years and was most recently CEO of a global gaming company, Demonware (an Activision company), where he was responsible for amongst other things online communities numbering 10s of millions. Tony has worked for IBM amongst others and is an active angel investor in Ireland.

Clive is a co founder and CTO of Plynk, the money messenger. He is a technology specialist with over 13 years experience in software development across online poker, re-insurance and digital finance. When he's not building Europe's first money messenger he has been known to play a hand or 2 of poker and dabble with improv comedy

As the Lead Principal Software Engineer in ASOS Technology, Nik Crabtree is responsible for Software and QA Engineering, UI Engineering and Data Engineering across the organisation. His role has a simple brief: come in every day with one aim – make engineering and engineers at ASOS better. Nik joined ASOS in March 2015 after six years at Avanade where he lead the Cloud & Integration Practice. Nik worked on both Azure and on-premises solutions with customers such as Skype, Blinkbox, Barclays, Best Buy and ASOS.

hydratedSession.description:
• How Digital Transformation has taken place within each company
  • Complexities and realities of introducing design thinking into larger organisations
  • Benefits and advantages of more focus on design thinking and UX methods
  • Trickling design thinking culture within the organisation
hydratedSession.name: Digital Transformation Within Large Complex Cultures

hydratedSpeakers.bio: Donal O Mahony is Head of UX and Product Design in Fleetmatics, a Verizon Company. where he leads a team of researchers, content specialists, user experience designers and UI designers. hydratedSession.name: Enhancing the Processes of Test Driven Development

hydratedSession.description:
• Building an amazing product is only one part the journey
  • Selling purpose to users
  • How to support users 24/7: Internal operations that go beyond a good UX
hydratedSession.name: UX That Goes Beyond the Solution for a Holistic Experience

hydratedSession.description:
• Collecting application performance metrics at Sky
  • Understanding how your service is performing to speed up production
  • Using histogram metrics to monitor response times
  • Good and bad practices when monitoring response times
hydratedSession.name: Improving Quality of Response Times: Application Performance Measurement

hydratedSpeakers.bio: Daniel Rolls is a senior developer at Sky where he is responsible for building web services for over the top delivery of video streams. Prior to joining Sky Daniel did a PhD in Computer Science and worked for various organisations including Xerox and The University of Hertfordshire. Daniel questioned the accuracy and interpretation of various metric dashboards and started investigating.

hydratedSession.description:
• Business benefits of incorporating legal into design team from the beginning
  • User testing - having a better understanding on what route to take based on variables
  • Reducing risk of fraud and waste
  • Improving app flow: Allowing users to contribute more data to provide a more accurate long-term experience
  • Integrating legal interpretation with common sense: Success to date
hydratedSession.name: An Unlikely Friendship in Legal and Design

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
As highly regulated industries like financial services, healthcare and energy are revolutionised by technology, tight coordination between legal, product and design is critical. Briana and her colleague Izac Ross are looking forward to coming to Dublin and sharing how Collective Health created a collaborative process that allowed us to effect massive change in the US health insurance system.


Briana is a regulatory compliance expert focusing on helping designers and product managers create beautiful, meaningful, and innovative products that comply with highly nuanced areas of law. She brings a diverse approach to her legal practice by integrating legal interpretation with practical process development. She’s passionate about improving the way the US pays for healthcare, and her mission is to leave no stone unturned in search of the solution that provides the best consumer experience and health outcome.


Prior to joining Collective Health, Briana developed policy and drafted regulations pursuant to the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (“Obamacare”). She conducted analysis of actuarial value to calculate government subsidies available to individuals and families who buy health insurance. She launched a registration and training program for agents and brokers nationwide, and a program integrity strategy for the Health Insurance Exchanges on the Healthcare.gov platform. 


Prior to her legal career, Briana reviewed tax returns for the US Treasury and taught English in Mexico. When Briana is not noodling on complex legal questions at Collective Health, you can find her crafting, enjoying nature, or doing volunteer tax preparation for low-income families.

Izac specialises in weaving together methods from interaction design, service management, business strategy and design research to solve problems that go beyond a single device, channel or medium. His mission: create the best possible experience for members of Collective Health.

Izac has a passion for working on complex problems in regulated industries. Prior to joining Collective Health, Izac held positions at Cooper, Moment Design and Philips Design. He has worked for a range of clients in healthcare, financial, and technology verticals including Philips Healthcare, Studio Dental, Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, Google, American Express, Morgan Stanley and Bloomberg.

Izac received a BFA in Service Design from Savannah College of Art and Design. When Izac is not designing Collective Health’s member experience you will find him improvising in the kitchen, hunting for new music and biking around the city.

hydratedSession.description:
• Why we need to rethink the current front-end development workflow?
  • How recent breakthroughs in AI are going to transform the way we build software?
  • What technology is behind the pix2code prototype?
  • How will UIzard allow front-end developers to focus on what matters?
hydratedSession.name: Startup Spotlight: Closing the Gap from Design to Code: Transforming Designs into Code

hydratedSession.description:
• Creating an impact with data: Selection process and principles
  • The magic box: Using mobility as a medium

  • Results of using data and design to track world disasters
  • Understanding the value of sharing info: How to make open source
  • Harnessing the power of startups to accelerate results
hydratedSession.name: Driving Positive Change through Real-Time Data & UX

hydratedSession.description:

  • The driver behind P2P and re-decentralising the web
  • The challenges in delivery - and the solution: standardJS
  • P2P for security and profit: what new models do P2P enable
hydratedSession.name: Re-decentralising the Web (P2P)

hydratedSpeakers.bio: Mathias Buus is a self taught Javascript hacker from Copenhagen. He works full time on open source projects and have been working with Node.js since the 0.2 days. Mathias likes to work with P2P and distributed systems and is the author of more than 550 modules on npm, including some of the most popular ones for working with streams. In addition he has spoken about mad science projects at various conferences around the world.

hydratedSession.description:
• Microsoft’s internal engineering systems: the pre DevOps days
  • Changing the company culture from the top and bottom up
  • The implementation approach
  • Unique challenges from Microsoft's structure
  • Lessons learned
hydratedSession.name: Moving 65,000 Microsofties to DevOps
The Golden Age of UX: Why it Won't Last

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
Jonathan Courtney is the co-founder of AJ&Smart, a multi-award winning digital product design agency based in Berlin. He writes a lot, and sometimes causes an industry fire with articles like this. But he also uses his writing for good and helps companies solve difficult design problems with new processes and snappy educational videos.

Jonathan has worked on products for companies like the United Nations, Lufthansa, Udacity, eBay, Zalando, Western Digital, UEFA, Red Bull and many more.


He also runs monthly product design events where he brings the best designers in the world in front of a live audience to nerd out. He’s interviewed design leaders from companies like Google, IDEO, Lego, GV, Fjord and many more.

hydratedSession.description:
• Progressive Web Apps
  • Microservices
  • React
  • P2P
hydratedSession.name: The Future of Engineering & Development

Mathias likes to work with P2P and distributed systems and is the author of more than 550 modules on npm, including some of the most popular ones for working with streams. He is passionate about building Mobile and Progressive Web products from the ground-up to deliver superior value and user experience to the end consumer. He is equally passionate about building great teams. He believes in a design language that prefers "People over Pixels". He is excited about start-ups that are solving challenging problems for emerging markets and he works with many such start-ups, mentoring them on all things Mobile. He is also an advisor to half a dozen startups. 

Prior to Flipkart, he worked at @WalmartLabs - he was involved in strategy development for Walmart’s next generation e-commerce Platform. He was also instrumental in setting up @walmartlabs India center of excellence.

Rob Campion is a Tech Lead at HubSpot. Rob is passionate about web development and has worked in the industry for almost 10 years. He began his career at IBM, before moving to MasterCard, Spencer Stuart and finally HubSpot. Since joining HubSpot, he’s worked on Website Grader, Customer Success Tooling and currently leads their efforts to transform notifications and communications via in-app, mobile and email messaging.

Rob currently builds web apps using ReactJS. He founded and co-organizes the ReactJS Dublin Meetup, which has grown to over 1,000 members.

Jonathan Courtney is the co-founder of AJ&Smart, a multi-award winning digital product design agency based in Berlin. He writes a lot, and sometimes causes an industry fire with articles like this. But he also uses his writing for good and helps companies solve difficult design problems with new processes and snappy educational videos.

Jonathan has worked on products for companies like the United Nations, Lufthansa, Udacity, eBay, Zalando, Western Digital, UEFA, Red Bull and many more.


He also runs monthly product design events where he brings the best designers in the world in front of a live audience to nerd out. He’s interviewed design leaders from companies like Google, IDEO, Lego, GV, Fjord and many more.

Michael is Co-Founder and CEO of Interplay.io, an innovative new platform which provides the fastest path possible from idea to tested user experience. We do this by integrating with existing design and development tools to enable the creation of fully functional, data-driven prototypes using you own Design System components. Prior to starting Interplay, Michael ran a successful design and development consultancy in Sydney, Australia for over 14 years, providing services to some of the world’s largest corporations such as Rio Tinto, ExxonMobil and Cadbury Schweppes.

John Moriarty is an interaction design lead with Fjord Dublin, part of Accenture’s new research and incubation hub. He leads multi-disciplinary design teams working on R&D projects, bringing user centred design and prototyping methods to emerging technology solutions. Prior to joining Fjord, he worked with HMH, building next generation digital education platforms and before that he set up and ran Design Partners' San Francisco product design studio. With a diverse background that spans physical and digital domains, he brings a holistic approach to design thinking and problem solving.

hydratedSession.description:
In traditional product prototyping, you build several rapid prototypes which lead to a decreasing amount of candidates and eventually one sellable product. The cornerstones of the process are failing fast, getting to market quickly and focusing on a single solid offering as the end result. The value in terms of external revenue comes from the working, sellable product, whilst the early prototypes and product candidates, that did not get used, are thrown away. Might we use the same thinking to create a new thing called concept software?

Conventional software innovation follows a distinctly different pattern to what other industries use to conceptualise new product ideas. Traditional software prototyping and what is known as concept cars are categorically different approaches to prototyping – with different outcomes. From the customer point of view, concept software has the potential to evolve brand perception, while increasing employee pride internally as the staff gets to work on cool stuff that is showcased to the world.

In this workshop, Rasmus will outline why succeeding slowly, with a slower market entry has the outcome of multiple products, decreased risk and greater revenue over time. He will provide a framework of how to design great products without the limitations of bringing a finished product to market as fast as possible.

What you will learn:

  • Reviewing the benefits of exploring multiple ideas in one unrealistic explorative and often futuristic, prototype
  • How to get those multiple, sellable products to market
  • How to explore beyond your category to build exceptional productsAllowing yourself and your organisation to push experimental product-free prototypes to the customer
  • Removing the fail fast thinking of getting to market fast one product
hydratedSession.name: Setting up Experimental Projects to Gauge the Viability of New Product Ideas

hydratedSession.description:
Designers are often frustrated that the end product is nothing like the intended design. As the product development continuously becomes more complex, communication between designers and developers has become more strained, which leads to friction, a poor design execution and severe product delays. The team at Netguru set out to identify what makes an effective design handover that can enable designers to empower developers to build great digital products in line with the brief.

Netguru will share a practical outline of how to build a well-functioning, enduring design process. This workshop is not about tooling; it’s about how to implement a more systematic approach to improving your design process and set up a shared language that can be understood, accepted and evolved within the company to produce visual output that renders designer’s intent.

Everyone in the product team could benefit from this workshop, but particularly visual and interaction designers and UX practitioners.

What you will walk away with:

  • A better understanding of the communication challenges between designers and developers
  • Best practices for accelerating product design
  • How to build a shared language within your organisation
  • Moving your design process from thinking in singularity to connected systems
  • How to strike a balance between reusability, consistency, and creative expression of the brand
  • Identifying problem patterns early in the design process
hydratedSession.name: How to Build a Design Process that Ensures Success in Development

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
Krzysztof Jackowski is a passionate developer and overall a very active guy. His technology of choice is Android. Krzysztof has been a specialising in this field for almost 5 years. It all started with an engineering project about Augmented Reality. Krzysztof is also an enthusiast of marketing and IT leadership.

Among many interests and hobbies, he loves travelling and meeting people with different backgrounds. He can always learn something new and exciting from them.

Pawel Kontek is a self-taught Product Designer with 3 years of experience. Working at Netguru, he has cooperated with start-ups and mature companies from industries like social care, education, networking and tourism. Recently, Pawel has focused on creating an app which uses psychological tests to help you plan your career path. His cooperation with developers is directed at working out processes which ensure the successful implementation of designers' work.

hydratedSession.description:
This half day of training will give you a tangible intro on how to run your own Design Sprint in your team. Learn the proven methods for building award-winning products, better and faster than everybody else. The team at AJ&Smart, who work with Jake Knapp, the author of the book Sprint, are joining us from Berlin to teach you the methods you can bring back, use and apply immediately to improve the way you, your team and company works. This is not a powerpoint fest on taking notes - it’s hands-on, it’s intense, it’s extremely practical and usable.

This Design Sprint training has been built with product managers in mind! But anybody involved in the creation of products or introduction of innovation processes in your company would benefit.

In this workshop you will learn:

  • Learn the exact tools to use to bring products to the market
  • Conceptualise, design and validate new products very fast, with very little waste
  • Understand how Design Sprints can solve specific problems and make a quick decision
  • Apply your learning immediately to real-life work situations
  • How to moderate a sprint
  • Tactics for integrating the Sprint into your company
hydratedSession.name: Design Sprints

hydratedSpeakers.bio:
Jonathan Courtney is the co-founder of AJ&Smart, a multi-award winning digital product design agency based in Berlin. He writes a lot, and sometimes causes an industry fire with articles like this. But he also uses his writing for good and helps companies solve difficult design problems with new processes and snappy educational videos.

Jonathan has worked on products for companies like the United Nations, Lufthansa, Udacity, eBay, Zalando, Western Digital, UEFA, Red Bull and many more.


He also runs monthly product design events where he brings the best designers in the world in front of a live audience to nerd out. He’s interviewed design leaders from companies like Google, IDEO, Lego, GV, Fjord and many more.

Brittni is a product strategist and awareness lead at AJ&Smart. With a background balanced in video advertising and tech, AJ&Smart’s efficient and process-driven approach to product design suits her really well. Oh, and she also does stand-up comedy sometimes.

hydratedSession.description:
This workshop will talk you through implenting a Lean UX methodology on Projects within your organisation. Shruti will provide you with practical takeaways that you, as a designer, can put to use using immediately.

From design sprints to team collaboration on UX, this Lean UX Workshop will provide you and your design team the missing piece to work well with your agile development teams. Everyone on the team will be on the same page before diving into implementation, ensuring you’re building something your customers really want!

What you will learn:

  • Design Sprints: Identify assumptions about your users and their needs
  • Understanding constraints, business goals, and potential paths to success
  • Project visioning: How to achieve a shared goal with the user experience in mind
  • Creation of a business model/lean canvas: How to achieve outcomes by understanding your assumptions, risks, and initial tactics?
  • Story mapping: What does the full customer experience look like? How can you test whether your ideas improve that? What will you measure?
  • Converting assumptions into experiments with actionable metrics
hydratedSession.name: How to Incorporate Lean UX into your Organisation

hydratedSession.description:
This 3 hour introduction to Cyberpsychology examines the online world and its impact on human and user behaviour. It is an essential area of expertise for anyone who wishes to make the most of online technologies.

Specifically, this workshop delivered by IADT, will delve into Cyberpsychology and the impact of new technologies on the user; from the latest mobile devices and gaming systems to high-end virtual reality equipment.

What you will learn:

  • User behaviour and communications online
  • Maximising online marketing
  • Psychological implications of virtual environments
  • Psychology of artificial intelligence and the future of online
hydratedSession.name: Introduction to Cyberpsychology
